docs.title: Obsidian Notes
docs.text: Publish your public notes with MkDocs

docs.title: Hello World!
docs.text:
The index.md in the /docs folder is the homepage you see here.

The folders in /docs appear as the main sections on the navigation bar.

The notes appear as pages within these sections. For example, [[Note 1]] in Topic 1

docs.title: Chapter 2. Weak topologies
docs.text: 1. Theorem 2.1 FA Riesz

docs.title: Inclusion function
docs.text: Inclusion map (insertion, canonical injection) is the function \(i\) between \(A\) and \(B\), \(A\subset B\) such that it maps any element of \(x\in A\) to the same \(x\in B\) \(\(i: x\in A\mapsto x\in B, \ \ \ \ i:A\to B: i(x)=x\)\) \(\(i: A\hookrightarrow B\)\)

docs.title: Jensen inequality
docs.text: Let \(p,q\in \[1,\infty\],p<q\), then \(\(\|x\|_{l^q}\leq \|x\|_{l^p} \ \forall x\in l^p\)\) then $$\forall p,q: 1\leq p<q<\infty \text{it has} l^p\hookrightarrow l^q\hookrightarrow c_0\hookrightarrow c\hookrightarrow l^\infty $$

docs.title: Lemma 1 FA
docs.text: \(E,F\) normed spaces, \(T: E\to F\) linear bounded, then \(\(\inf \{ c>0: \mid\mid Tx\mid\mid_F \ \leq \ c\mid\mid x\mid\mid_E \}=\sup_{x\neq 0}\frac{\mid\mid Tx\mid\mid_F}{\mid\mid x\mid\mid_E}=\sup_{\mid\mid x\mid\mid_E \ = 1 }\mid\mid Tx\mid\mid_F=\sup_{\mid\mid x\mid\mid_E \ \leq 1 }\mid\mid Tx\mid\mid_F\)\)

docs.title: Lemma 2 FA
docs.text: \(F\) is a [[Banach space]] then [[Dual topological space]] is also a [[Banach space]]

docs.title: Lemma 3 FA
docs.text: Norms \(\|. \|_1 \ , \ \|. \|_2\) are equivalent iff \(\exists c_1,c_2>0\in \mathbb{R}:\) $$c_1 |x |_1 \leq |x |_2 \leq c_2|x |_1 $$

docs.title: Lemma 4 FA
docs.text: \(T: \mathbb{R}^n\to E\) normed space 1. \(T\) is linear, hence \(T\) is continuous 2. \(T\) is linear bijective, then \(T,T^{-1}\) are continuous 3. \(E\) is a normed space with \(\dim (E)<\infty\) and \(T: E\to F\) linear, \(F\) is normed space, then \(T\) is continuous 4. \(\dim (E)<\infty\) then all the norms are equivalent

docs.title: Lemma 6 FA
docs.text: let \(E\) is a Normed space, \(G\subseteq E\), \(x_0\in E-G\), \(dist(x_0, G)\neq 0\) then $$ \exists f\in E': f(x_0) \text{and} f(x)=0 \forall x\in G $$

docs.title: Lemma 8 FA
docs.text: Let \(E\) is a [[Banach space]], \(G,L\subseteq E\) closed subspaces, such that \(G+L\) is closed in \(E\), then \(\(\exists c>0: \forall z\in G+L\ \exists x\in G, y\in L: z=x+y,\ \|x\|\leq c\|z\|,\ \|y\|\leq c\|z\|\)\)

docs.title: Lemma 9 FA
docs.text: Let \(E\) is a [[Banach space]], \(G\) accepts the complement (supplement) topology if and only if there exists the linear and continuous projection from \(E\) to \(G\)

docs.title: Linear projection
docs.text: Let \(E\) is a vector linear space, \(G\subseteq E\), the projection(linear) from \(E\) to \(G\) is a function (linear) \(p: E\to G\) such that \(p(x)=x\ \ \forall x\in G\)

docs.title: Metric space
docs.text: a space \(M\) is called metric space if it is a [[Topological space]] endowed with a metric

docs.title: Norm
docs.text: Given a vector space \(X\) and a field \(F\subseteq \mathbb{C}\) we call a real-valued function \(p:X\to F\) a norm if 1. \(p(x)+p(y)\geq p(x+y) \ \forall x,y\in X\) 2. \(p(\lambda x) = |\lambda| p(x) \ \forall x\in X, \lambda\in F\) 3. \(p(x)=0 \iff x=0\)

docs.title: Normed space
docs.text: is a space where the norm is defined

docs.title: Open map theorem
docs.text: Let \(E,F\) are [[Banach space]] and let \(T: E\to F\) linear and continuous functions. If \(T\) is [[Surjective|surjective]] then \(T\) is open (means that \(T\) maps open set to open set)

docs.title: Theorem 1 FA
docs.text: \(E,F\) normed spaces, \(T:E\to F\) linear, then the following is equivalent 1. \(T\) is continuous 2. \(T\) is continuous at point \(x_0\in E\) 3. \(T\) is continuous at point \(0\) 4. \(\exists c>0 : \mid\mid Tx \mid\mid_F\ \leq \ c\mid\mid x\mid\mid_E\)

docs.title: Theorem 7 FA
docs.text: Let \(E\) is a [[Banach space]], \(E=G\oplus L\) with \(G,L\subseteq E\), then \(G\oplus L\) is topological if and only if the normal projections $$ P_G: \underset{x+y\mapsto x}{E\to G}, P_L: \underset{x+y\mapsto y}{E\to L} $$ are continuous

docs.title: Theorem 8 FA
docs.text: Let \(E\) is a [[Banach space]], \(G\subseteq E\) 1. if \(dim\ G\neq \infty\) then \(G\) is closed and admits the [[Complement topology|supplementary(complementary)]] topology 2. if \(G\) is closed and \(dim\ E/G\neq\infty\) then \(G\) admits the [[Complement topology|supplementary(complementary)]] topology

docs.title: Theorem Banach Steinhaus
docs.text:
Let \(E\) is a [[Banach space]], \(F\) is a Normed space, \(T_i, \ i\in I\) is a family of linear and continuous operators from \(E\) to \(F\). Suppose that $$ \sup_{i\in I} |Tx_i|F< \infty \forall x\in E $$ then $$ \sup{i\in I} |T|_{\mathcal{L}(E,F)}< \infty $$

$$

$$

docs.title: Theorem Riesz
docs.text: Let \(E\) is a Normed space, \(dim\ E= \infty\), then $$ B_E(0,1]={ x\in E\big| |x|\leq 1 } $$ is not compact

docs.title: particular case
docs.text: Let \(V\subseteq E\), \(dim\ V\neq \infty\), then \(\exists z\in E, \|z\|=1\), such that \(dist(z,V)\geq 1\)

docs.title: Zorn lemma
docs.text: Every ordered inductive non-empty set has a maximal element
